title: Drake hits back at dad Dennis Graham claiming he lied in his music
text:
Drake says he is ‘so hurt’ over dad Dennis Graham accusing him of lying in his music (Picture: Getty Images)

Drake is not happy with dad Dennis Graham and he wants everyone to know it.

Champagne Papi told fans on Tuesday that he has been left ‘so hurt’ by his father, after Dennis accused Drake of lying about their relationship in his music.

It’s no secret that the pair haven’t had the best relationship over the years and Drake has been known to address his childhood – especially his dad not being around – in his tracks.

It’s not like they don’t completely get on, as Drake was seen calling his dad the ‘superstar of the family’ while giving his OG a birthday shoutout last month, but Dennis’ latest claims have left the rapper a little irked.

Speaking on Nick Cannon’s talk show on Power 106, Dennis, who has been releasing music of his own since 2017, suggested that Drake had sensationalised the pair’s relationship to ‘sell records’.

He said: ‘I have always been with Drake. I talked to him, if not every day, every other day, and we really got into a deep conversation about that.

‘I said, “Drake, why are you saying all of this different stuff about me, man? This is not cool,” and then he goes, “Dad, it sells records.”‘

Drake publicly hit back at his dad (Picture: Instagram)

The ‘stuff’ Dennis is referring to is lyrics like this in Drake’s hit Take Care: ‘And my father living in Memphis now, he can’t come this way/ Over some minor charges and child support/ That just wasn’t paid, damn/ Boo-hoo, sad story/ Black American dad story.’

Drake, however, insists his music only speaks the truth.

Publicly hitting back at his dad, Drake posted to his Instagram story and told fans he was ‘so hurt’ by the accusations.

‘Woke up today so hurt man,’ he wrote. ‘My father will say anything to anyone that’s willing to listen to him. It’s sad when family gets like this, but what can we really do – that’s the people we are stuck with.’

‘Every bar I ever spit was the truth,’ Drake said. ‘And the truth is hard for some people to accept.’
